對抗一帶一路 美國正式推出「藍點計劃」

06 Nov 2019, 07:35

【新唐人北京時間2019年11月06日訊】美國商務部長羅斯週二表示，美國將在亞洲增加投資和貿易，而即將推出的「藍點網絡」計劃即旨在幫助亞洲「永續發展」。有英媒披露，由美國領導的「藍點網絡計劃」將審核並認證項目，從而促進「市場驅動、透明且財務可持續的基礎設施發展」。輿論認為，美國推出「藍點網絡計劃」是為了對抗中共的「一帶一路」。
羅斯（Wilbur Ross）率領高階貿易代表團與白宮國家安全顧問奧布萊恩（Robert C. O’Brien）近日出席了在泰國首都曼谷近郊舉行的區域峰會，並於11月5日在這個會議上宣布了川普（特朗普）政府推出的「藍點網絡」（Blue Dot Network）計劃。
據美聯社報導，羅斯在電話會議上強調：「我們將繼續在這裏投資更多，而且我們將繼續推動更多的雙邊貿易，還有我要花更多時間關注這個地區。」
奧布萊恩則形容這項計劃像是評鑑基礎建設投資計劃的「米其林指南」（Michelin Guide），包括維持經濟和社會運轉的道路、港口和能源系統等建設計劃。
美國政府表示，這項計劃是要把諸如澳洲和日本等國家的政府、企業和民間社會結合起來，在「共同標準下」審核認證建設計劃。
據英國《金融時報》報導，「藍點網絡計劃」的名稱取自天文學家卡爾•薩根(Carl Sagan)對太空照片中地球的描述：「暗淡藍點」(pale blue dot)。這是一項為大型基建項目設定國際標準的認證計劃，旨在通過審核並認證項目，在亞洲乃至世界各地促進「市場驅動、透明且財務可持續的」基礎設施發展。
報導稱，「藍點網絡計劃」 最初將由海外私人投資公司(OPIC)攜手日本國際協力銀行(JBIC)和澳大利亞外交貿易部(Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade)領導，而該計劃的組織者將組建一個指導委員會以發展該計劃，邀請其他國家、私營企業和公民社會團體加入。
該報導引述美國商務部長威爾伯•羅斯(Wilbur Ross)稱，「每個藍點都是地圖上的一個點，只要相關企業對可持續的基礎設施項目感興趣，這些點就是它們可以運作的安全場所，關鍵是展現出對項目可持續性的重視。」
近幾年北京當局推出了名為「一帶一路」的發展計劃，其中部份導致與中方合作的國家政府陷入了債務陷阱，或者發生了腐敗或污染破壞環境以及侵犯當地工人權利等情況，例如在斯里蘭卡、緬甸和老撾的項目。因此，《金融時報》的報導認為，美國政府推出「藍點網絡計劃」是為了對抗中共的「一帶一路」計劃。
（記者黎明綜合報導/責任編輯：明軒）

Fight against the Belt and Road, the United States officially launched the "Blue Dot Program"

06 Nov 2019, 07:35

[New Tang Dynasty, Beijing time, November 06, 2019] US Secretary of Commerce Ross said on Tuesday that the United States will increase investment and trade in Asia, and the forthcoming "Blue Dot Network" program is designed to help Asia "sustainable development." According to British media, the US-led Blue Point Network Program will review and certify projects to promote "market-driven, transparent and financially sustainable infrastructure development." Public opinion believes that the United States launched the "Blue Point Network Plan" to counter the CCP's "Belt and Road."
Wilbur Ross led a high-level trade delegation and White House national security adviser Robert C. O'Brien to attend a regional summit in the outskirts of Bangkok, Thailand, and announced at the conference on November 5th. The "Blue Dot Network" program launched by Trump (Trump) government.
According to the Associated Press, Ross stressed in a conference call: "We will continue to invest more here, and we will continue to promote more bilateral trade, and I will spend more time focusing on this area."
O'Brien described the plan as a Michelin Guide for evaluating infrastructure investment plans, including roads to maintain economic and social operations, ports and energy systems.
The US government said the plan is to combine governments, businesses, and civil society in countries such as Australia and Japan to review certification and construction plans under "common standards."
According to the Financial Times, the name of the Blue Dot Network Project is taken from the description of the Earth in the space photo by astronomer Carl Sagan: "Pale blue dot." This is a certification program that sets international standards for large-scale infrastructure projects to promote “market-driven, transparent and financially sustainable” infrastructure development in Asia and around the world through auditing and certification projects.
The report said that the "Blue Doll Network Plan" will initially be led by the Overseas Private Investment Corporation (OPIC) in conjunction with the Japan International Cooperation Bank (JBIC) and the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade, and the organizers of the plan will form a The Steering Committee to develop the program invites other countries, private companies and civil society groups to join.
The newspaper quoted Wilbur Ross, US Secretary of Commerce, as saying, “Each blue dot is a point on the map, as long as the companies are interested in sustainable infrastructure projects, these are the things they can operate. The key to a safe place is to show the importance of project sustainability."
In recent years, the Beijing authorities have launched a development plan called “Belt and Road”, in which some of the governments that have cooperated with China have fallen into debt traps, or corruption or pollution has damaged the environment and violated the rights of local workers. Projects in Sri Lanka, Myanmar and Laos. Therefore, the Financial Times reported that the US government launched the "Blue Point Network Plan" to counter the CCP's "One Belt, One Road" plan.
(Reporter Liming Comprehensive Report / Responsible Editor: Ming Xuan)
